eu.linksmart.caf.cm
Interface ContextManager

All Superinterfaces:
DacCallbackInterface, DaqcReportingService, EventSubscriber, java.rmi.Remote
public interface ContextManager
extends DaqcReportingService, EventSubscriber, DacCallbackInterface, java.rmi.Remote

The interface for the Context Manager.

The Context Manager allows for pluggable rules, included in ContextSpecifications, that perform the interpretation of data from data sources, providing situational awareness, with associated context-sensitive actions to be performed.

In addition, it provides mechanisms for the provisioning of contextual information, through installable queries (QuerySet) - to accompany the default queries.

This interfaces defines the methods for the creation / installation and management of ContextSpecifications and QuerySets, and also the methods for querying the Context Manager.

Author:
Michael Crouch

Method Detail

installApplicationContext

ContextResponse installApplicationContext(ContextSpecification specification,
                                          java.lang.String hid)
                                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Installs the Application context defined by the ContextSpecification in the Context Manager. The associated ContextRuleSet is inserted into the Rule Engine, along with the stubs of the context itself. The context is associated with the given HID.

Any additional data required by the Context are processed.

Returns an error if the application already exists.

Returns a ContextResponse containing the success of the operation, including any errors - as ContextManagerErrors.

Parameters:
specification - the ContextSpecification
hid - the HID of the installed application
Returns:
the ContextResponse
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

installApplicationContextAsXml

java.lang.String installApplicationContextAsXml(java.lang.String specification,
                                                java.lang.String hid)
                                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Installs the Application Context, defined by the ContextSpecification provided encoded as String XML.

The associated ContextRuleSet is inserted into the Rule Engine, along with the stubs of the context itself. The context is associated with the given HID.

Any additional data required by the Context are processed.

Returns the contextId of the newly created context, or throws an exception with the processing errors

Parameters:
specification - the ContextSpecification as Xml
hid - the HID of the application
Returns:
the contextId of the created context
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - any errors processing the ContextSpecification

getContextIdsMatchingQuery

java.lang.String[] getContextIdsMatchingQuery(java.lang.String query)
                                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Gets all contextIds that match the given query. The query should assign the query results to the variable output.

Example query:

output : Device( deviceType == "Thermometer" )

Parameters:
query -
Returns:
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

executeNamedQuery

QueryResponse executeNamedQuery(java.lang.String queryName,
                                Parameter[] args)
                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Executes the query with the given name, passing the given Parameters as arguments. Query results are returned in a QueryResponse.

If no arguments to the query, pass null or an empty Parameter array.

Parameters:
queryName - the name of the query
args - array of Parameters as arguments
Returns:
the query results, as QueryResponse
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

executeSingleQuery

QueryResponse executeSingleQuery(ContextQuery query)
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Executes the argument-less ContextQuery passed, and returns the results in a QueryResponse. The query should assign the query results to the variable output.

Parameters:
query - the ContextQuery
Returns:
the QueryResponse
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

executeQuery

java.lang.String executeQuery(java.lang.String query)
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Executes the DRL-formatted query, given as a String. The result is encoded as XML, with wrapper tags as follows:

<output>Encoded Output</output>

The output of the query must be assigned to the variable "output"

Parameters:
query - the DRL query
Returns:
the encoded results
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if there are errors with the query etc
